title: 11k-Mile 2009 Ferrari F430 Scuderia
description: This 2009 Ferrari 430 Scuderia was specified in Rosso Scuderia with tri-color stripes over black and red leather, and it has 11k miles. The car is powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8 paired with a six-speed F1 automated transaxle, and equipment includes bronze-finished 19" Scuderia alloy wheels, an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, Brembo carbon-ceramic brake rotors, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, carbon-fiber-framed seats, a fire extinguisher, and automatic climate control. Purchased by its current owner in April 2019, this F430 Scuderia is now offered on dealer consignment with the owner's manual, tools, and a Washington title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 11k-Mile 2009 Ferrari F430 Scuderia at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #199,847.
text: This 2009 Ferrari 430 Scuderia was specified in Rosso Scuderia with tri-color stripes over black and red leather, and it has 11k miles. The car is powered by a 4.3-liter DOHC V8 paired with a six-speed F1 automated transaxle, and equipment includes bronze-finished 19″ Scuderia alloy wheels, an electronically controlled limited-slip differential, Brembo carbon-ceramic brake rotors, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, carbon-fiber-framed seats, a fire extinguisher, and automatic climate control. Purchased by its current owner in April 2019, this F430 Scuderia is now offered on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, tools, and a Washington title. The exterior is finished in Rosso Scuderia with tri-color stripes, and additional equipment includes xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a rear diffuser, and dual exhaust finishers that exit through the rear valance. The Carfax report indicates that a May 2009 accident involving another vehicle resulted in damage to the rear-right corner. The selling dealer tells us that much of the car was repainted at that time. The rear window was replaced in September 2020. The bronze-finished 19″ Scuderia alloy wheels are mounted with older Bridgestone RE-71 Potenza tires. Braking is handled by red-finished brake calipers fitted over Brembo carbon-ceramic rotors. The brake fluid reservoir cap was replaced in March 2024. The cockpit features carbon-fiber-framed seats upholstered in black and red leather mounted over exposed diamond-plate aluminum flooring. Carbon fiber trims the console, door panels, and dashboard. Equipment includes automatic climate control, drilled aluminum pedals, and power windows and locks. A fire extinguisher is stationed in the passenger-side foot well. A portion of the headliner above the driver’s seat is damaged, and shrunken leather is evident on the dash. The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel features an integrated LED shift light, an engine-start button, carbon-fiber shift paddles, and a manettino dial for control of dynamic settings. Instrumentation includes a central tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a 220-mph speedometer and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and oil pressure. The digital odometer indicates 11k miles, approximately 3k of which were added during current ownership. The mid-mounted 4.3-liter V8 features a flat-plane crankshaft, two overhead camshafts per cylinder bank, four valves per cylinder, and an 11.9:1 compression ratio. Output was factory rated at 503 horsepower and 347 lb-ft of torque in Scuderia trim. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed F1 automated transaxle and an electronically controlled limited-slip differential. According to the selling dealer, the differential solenoid was replaced and the oil pump was resealed in December 2020. The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident.
